snippet: An internal Federal Trade Commission report recommended that the agency take action against Google for anticompetitive practices. The F.T.C. voted not to bring charges.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission internal report reveals that staff encouraged agency to sue Google for anticompetitive practices in 2012, but FTC voted not to bring charges in 2013; Google's competitors and critics call on Europe to pursue stringent regulations.

byline.original: By REBECCA R. RUIZ and CONOR DOUGHERTY

lead_paragraph: An internal Federal Trade Commission report recommended that the agency take action against Google for anticompetitive practices. The F.T.C. voted not to bring charges.

headline.main: Take Google to Court, Staff Report Urged F.T.C.
headline.print_headline: Take Google to Court, Staff Report Urged F.T.C.
